forecast.name: New Year's Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. Southeast wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. Southeast wind around 5 mph.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco today, a gentle embrace of partly sunny skies brings a sense of quiet optimism as the new year unfolds. The atmosphere is crisp, with temperatures hovering around a mild 57, gradually softening to a cooler 55 as the afternoon unfolds. Vestiges of the marine layer linger, imparting a muted clarity to the horizon, where hints of fog tease the outline of the Golden Gate Bridge, softly blurring the edges of this iconic landmark. The breeze, a light southeast whisper, adds a touch of briskness, foreshadowing the deepening evening chill, when clouds will weave thicker over the city, settling into a cozy blanket of gray as nighttime descends.

A patchy marine layer, lingering near the coastline, invites strollers to don light layers—perhaps a soft sweater paired with a light jacket for those evening ventures. As day transitions to dusk, the charm of the city lingers in myriad pedestrian cafes and artful little shops lining the streets. Perhaps a leisurely walk along the waterfront to enjoy the reflections on the bay or savoring a warm drink while breathing in the salty air might serve as exquisite solace on this reflective January day.
